results.title: Three gifts

results.title: Cold front
results.brief_description: Depicts the passage of a cold front breaking a summer heat wave. Blends the themes of the experience of weather in the city and the scientific concept of air masses and frontal systems.

results.title: Garry Greenwood: leather worker
results.creator_credit: Dinah Van Dugteren and Australia Council
results.brief_description: Garry Greenwood works at shaping leather into sculptural forms by hammering it over a stone. He also runs a gallery at his mill in Deloraine, Tasmania, and gathers most of his inspiration from nature. Suitable for secondary level.
results.description: Garry Greenwood works at shaping leather into sculptural forms by hammering it over a stone. He also runs a gallery at his mill in Deloraine, Tasmania, and gathers most of his inspiration from nature. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Topology
results.creator_credit: Harold Whitaker, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
An animated film which illustrates those properties of geometric figures or solid bodies which remain invariant under certain transformations.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Clothing and fashion: a history
results.brief_description: The evolution of fashions in clothing, from Egyptian times until today, is perceived in amusing animation. The choice to cover the body with unnatural materials has been made largely for social status, conformity and vanity. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: The evolution of fashions in clothing, from Egyptian times until today, is perceived in amusing animation. The choice to cover the body with unnatural materials has been made largely for social status, conformity and vanity. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Poky little puppy
results.creator_credit: Allan Frank Sandler, Little Golden Books Films, Sandler Institutional Films and Zagreb Film
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon about five puppies, one of whom calculates how to eat the desserts of the others. Designed to teach reading and number recognition. For primary grades. Based on the book of the same title by Janette Sebring Lowrey. Consultant Chuck Jones-Animator

results.title: Dr Seuss on the loose: the Zax
results.creator_credit: Hawley Pratt, Isadore Freleng, Ted Geisel, CBS TV and DePatie-Freleng Enterprises
results.brief_description: A north-going Zax and a south-going Zax meet face-to-face on their journeys and neither is willing to budge. Their stubbornness and inability to change are presented most humorously in this animated film based on the original illustrations.
